Not even sure where to start. Before I start boring anyone with this long review, let me say Chris and Claire have to be the best Airbnb hosts there are in the business.  Their thoughtfulness, heart and love for this home is beyond anything we've experienced with any other stay.
We were at Clarkhaus for the coldest weather in 115 years for Oklahoma.  The temperatures dipped to well below zero, snow fell, pipes froze, power went out, you name it.  But Chris and Claire never skipped a beat.  Chris literally spent an entire day defrosting the pipes while making sure it wouldn't happen again during our stay.  They even offered our family a place to stay at their personal home if the pipes did not defrost.
Then Oklahoma started it's rolling blackouts because the grid was getting overwhelmed from the frigid temperatures.  Out of nowhere, Clark had the generator cranked up, connected and we had power.  I cannot say how impressed we are and how we almost feel like we've become friends/family through this stay. 
If you're looking for a home near The Wichita Mountains, Medicine Park, Quartz Mountains, etc, Clarkhaus is your place to stay.  Don't even think about it. Just book it.  The pictures do no justice of the views you'll get.  The home is also well equipped with everything you need, as well as great literature for the nearby areas.  We cannot wait to come back!

A stay at Clarkhaus in the winter provides airtight comfort and an opportunity to experience the stark beauty of the foothills of the Wichita Mountains.
We had stayed at Clarkhaus and in the area before, but never during the winter. Both of us are averse to the cold so we travel in the winter with some trepidation. Will our lodging be comfortable or will we spend our time huddling and cursing the cold?
Clarkhaus sits on a rise without natural wind breaks. The temperature dropped low one night and the wind was so strong we could hear it outside. Inside the temperature was moderate and comfortable. The house is airtight and was a wonderful place to take a Christmas trip. No cold drafts or places in the house that wouldn't warm up.
All of the good things you read about Clarkhaus and Chris and Claire here are true. No need to be repetitive. You can believe what you read. We also had the opportunity to meet and spend some time with the nearest neighbors who are just delightful people and were happy to share with us their history and experience of living life in the foothills of the Wichitas.
Consider a winter visit to Clarkhaus and experience the terrain with the winter positioning of the sun. It's like being a part of a panorama with its shifting colors and shadows. It's a great trip with a great place to stay.

Clarkhaus sits on an open rise at the foot of the Wichita Mountains. It is starkly beautiful and forty miles from civilization as most people know it. You can see thousands of stars in the nighttime sky, hear the lowing of cattle and the yapping of coyotes, and feel the persistent plains wind.

It is immaculately maintained and features all the amenities one wants or needs. Direct written instructions for practically everything about the house, its use, and appliances are provided.

We found in the Clarkhouse what we were looking for and so much more! I will start with the location: If you want to explore beautiful South-West Oklahoma, the house is a just few scenic miles away to the Wildlife Refuge, Quartz Mountain and Medicine Park, just to name a few. Then you come back home to this serene location with absolutely no people around you, and you just want to sit on the front porch or on the wooded bench to zip a glass of wine while savoring the peaceful view and sounds of nature. We loved walking by the old chicken house that is located in the property and waiting for the beautiful sunset there, while hearing the cows, birds and coyotes. You have 15 acres for yourself to enjoy!
Let us talk about the inside of the house: this house is IMPECABLE! Every area is absolutely spotless and the hosts just thought about every little detail to make your stay comfortable. Kitchen is fully equipped and includes all the basics like coffee, tea and all sort of condiments. Keurig machine was a great plus with really good coffee options! We only got to use the master bedroom (the bed was delicious!) and it is a big bedroom with its own bathroom (great shower and good water flow). All bathrooms have soap, shampoo and conditioner dispensers. Plenty of good towels in all the bathrooms.
The house has a comfy living room with TV and there are speakers all around the house so we were able to play our old country music and enjoy ourselves. There are also good books all around the house, so If you are a reader just relax in one of the reclining chairs and read away! There are so many thoughtful details in every corner of this house that I was blown away! This is the type of place you just come and not worry about anything. Just relax and enjoy. But bring all your food and gas because this is a remote location (which is what makes it so perfect) and you will need to drive 45 minutes for provisions.
Last but not least, host communication was fantastic. Claire contacted us a few days in advance to make sure we had the right directions to avoid getting lost. She was checking on us the day of the trip as well and also during our stay to make sure we were doing okay. She and her husband were doing some yard work when we arrived to the property to we were able to meet briefly. They are really nice people and we wished we could have visited with them a little bit more.
We will definitely be back and I am already planning a girlfriends hiking trip since this house will be perfect for a women retreat!

Overall this worked well for our needs. And the price would be hard to beat. Me and family stayed for 5 nights and Rachel was really responsive to questions and messages. If it was just me I would stay there again but if I was bringing my kids again I probably wouldn't.
I mentioned these items to Rachel already, so hopefully some of them will be resolved for the next family staying here.
1. The large tv is a hazard for small children. It was was not secured and the TV stand was barely large enough to hold it. The TV should be secured somehow. We had to work to keep kids away from it.
2. There are slightly raised nails on the threshold to the kitchen that my baby girl scraped her foot on twice. No serious injury thankfully.
3. Some room darkening curtains would be nice for bedrooms. The mini blinds provide privacy but also let in too much light if you want your kids (and your self) to sleep past sunrise). We bought some from Walmart to use for the week and it was worth it.
4. I don't know if this typical in Altus but the mosquitoes got really bad inside the house. We never left the doors open. We all got tons of bites and my son had some really bad ones. We were glad to leave the house when it was time.
5. There were no clear instructions provided for getting rid of trash and other cleaning procedures.
Nit-picky stuff.
1. The tall weeds in the front lawn was not an issue but made a bad first impression
2. Also there was debris in the front yard and driveway which also hurt the curb appeal
Again, hard to compete with the price. But I hope the host will consider improving some of things above.
